ArticleTitle.sentence: Targeted degradation of c-Fos, but not v-Fos, by a phosphorylation-dependent signal on c-Jun.

AbstractText.sentence: The proto-oncogene products c-Fos and c-Jun heterodimerize through their leucine zippers to form the AP-1 transcription factor.

event.clue: The proto-oncogene products c-Fos and c-Jun heterodimerize through their leucine zippers to form the AP-1 transcription factor.

AbstractText.sentence: The transcriptional activity of the heterodimer is regulated by signal-dependent phosphorylation and dephosphorylation events.

event.clue: The transcriptional activity of the heterodimer is regulated by signal-dependent phosphorylation and dephosphorylation events.

AbstractText.sentence: The stability of c-Fos was found to also be controlled by intracellular signal transduction.

event.clue: The stability of c-Fos was found to also be controlled by intracellular signal transduction.

AbstractText.sentence: In transient expression and in vitro degradation experiments, the stability of c-Fos was decreased when the protein was dimerized with phosphorylated c-Jun.

AbstractText.sentence: c-Jun protein isolated from phorbol ester-induced cells did not target c-Fos for degradation, which suggests that c-Fos is transiently stabilized after stimulation of cell growth.

AbstractText.sentence: v-Fos protein, the retroviral counterpart of c-Fos, was not susceptible to degradation targeted by c-Jun.
